Instruction: Slice the spaghetti squash in half lengthwise and scoop out the seeds.
Brush the cut sides of the squash with olive oil and season with salt and black pepper.
Place the squash halves cut-side down on a baking sheet.
Bake for 40-50 minutes, or until the squash is tender and the strands can easily be scraped with a fork.
While the squash is baking, mince the garlic and chop the fresh parsley.
Once the squash is done, use a fork to scrape the strands into a bowl.
Mix in minced garlic, Parmesan cheese, and chopped parsley.
Serve hot as a tasty and low-carb side dish.
